Another compelling choice is "Downfall," which offers an intense exploration of personal struggles and redemption, featuring Bruno Ganz in a powerful performance. Enjoy the movies!

Additionally, if you're interested in a more contemporary tragedy with a unique twist, "Restless" might appeal to you as well. This film follows a group of friends navigating their last summer of freedom, featuring Mia Wasikowska and Hayley Atwell. Enjoy the movies!

It sounds like you're in the mood for a thought-provoking film by Rupert Wainwright. I'd recommend giving "Elysium" (2013) a try, starring Matt Damon and Sharlto Copley. This tragic drama takes place in a future where the rich live on a space station while Earth is ruined, presenting an engaging exploration of societal inequality.

If you're also interested in exploring themes of family dynamics, "Afterlife" (2011) could be another great choice for you. This movie features a unique premise about understanding and connecting with a deceased loved one.

"All My Sons" is a gripping drama that explores the consequences of past actions when war secrets come to light, with an exceptional cast featuring Burt Lancaster and Mildred Dunnock.

"Donnie Darko", on the other hand, is a thought-provoking tragic tale about a troubled teenager who experiences time travel and manipulation by a mysterious entity, starring Jake and Maggie Gyllenhaal. Both movies offer captivating narratives that might appeal to your current interests. Enjoy the watch!
